newsitem.title: USA: Glickman to raise wheat, pork at S. Africa meeting.
newsitem.headline: Glickman to raise wheat, pork at S. Africa meeting.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman said he planned to bring up wheat, pork and poultry trade issues in an upcoming meeting with South African Minister of Agriculture and Land Affairs Derek Andre Hanekom.

Glickman leaves for South Africa on Wednesday to take part in U.S.-South Africa Binational Commission meetings scheduled for February 14-17. Glickman and Hanekom co-chair the commission's agriculture committee.
Glickman said the U.S. would like to see South Africa reconsider its decision not to accept wheat from U.S. quarantine areas though the wheat had twice tested negative for the fungus karnal bunt.
He also said the U.S. was concerned about the freezing requirements on pork imports and does not want to see South Africa increase poultry tariffs.
"None of these are hard-edged issues, they're all progressing in good faith and I'll be reinforcing our position and the importance of a timely, fair resolution," Glickman said.
